events.title: Paper Presentation
events.desc: Participants present a paper on a topic of their choice related to technology or computer science. The presentation should be followed by a Q&A session.
rules: Participants must submit a paper in advance.
Presentation should only be 7-10 minutes long.
Not more than 15 slides per presentation.

rounds.name: Abstract Submission
rounds.description: Submit a 300-word abstract on any topic related to technology or computer science. Shortlisted teams will proceed to the next round.

rounds.name: Presentation
rounds.description: Present your paper using slides (max 15). Each team gets 7-10 minutes followed by a 3-minute Q&A.

moreInfo: Participants not participating in the Code Relay event are allowed First batch only.
Participants participating in the Code Relay are allowed in Second batch only.

events.title: Code Relay
events.desc: Code Relay is a competitive programming event where problems must be solved in a strict sequential order. The output of each question serves as the input for the next.
rules: Participants must solve problems in a sequential order.
Participants must submit their solutions within the given time limit.

rounds.name: Prelims
rounds.description: Solve 10 MCQ-based questions on programming fundamentals. Top 20 participants advance.

rounds.name: Relay Round
rounds.description: Solve 5 chained coding problems. The output of each becomes the input for the next. Languages allowed: C, C++, Java, Python.

moreInfo: Participants not participating in the Paper Presentation event are allowed First batch only.
Participants participating in the Paper Presentation are allowed in Second batch only.

events.title: Query Craft
events.desc: Query Craft is an SQL based event where participants are given a database and must write SQL queries to extract specific information. The queries will be evaluated based on correctness and efficiency.
rules: Queries will be evaluated based on correctness and efficiency.
Participants must submit their queries within the given time limit.

rounds.name: Round 1 — Basics
rounds.description: Write simple SELECT, JOIN, and aggregate queries on a provided schema. Top 15 move on.

rounds.name: Round 2 — Advanced
rounds.description: Complex queries involving subqueries, window functions, and optimization. Judged on correctness and execution time.

events.title: Tech Quiz
events.desc: A fast-paced quiz covering general knowledge, aptitude, current affairs, and fun trivia. Teams compete in buzzer rounds to claim the crown.

rounds.name: Prelims
rounds.description: 30 rapid-fire written questions. Top 6 teams advance.

rounds.name: Buzzer Round
rounds.description: Head-to-head buzzer questions with bonus and penalty scoring.

events.title: Treasure Hunt
events.desc: Crack clues, decode puzzles, and race across the campus to find the hidden treasure before anyone else.
rules: Clues must be solved in order.
Use of phones for clue-solving is not allowed.

rounds.name: Single Round
rounds.description: Teams follow a chain of 8 clues hidden across campus. First team to find the final treasure wins.

moreInfo: Wear comfortable shoes — you will be running!
Teams caught using phones will be disqualified.
